intro: Ceropegia arenarioides, commonly known as the sand ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often pale green or yellowish, and they attract specific pollinators such as moths. Ceropegia arenarioides is a succulent plant, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves.
